algorithm_technique: Two-pass greedy approach: first left-to-right, then right-to-left.
problem_summary_simple: Distribute candies to children based on ratings, ensuring each gets at least one and higher ratings get more than neighbors.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy algorithm using a two-pass approach on an array to satisfy adjacent rating conditions for minimum candies.
key_insights: The problem requires satisfying local conditions (neighboring ratings) globally.
A single pass is insufficient; a two-pass approach handles both left and right neighbor dependencies.
Initialize with 1 candy per child to satisfy the minimum requirement.
